qas.question: When was the Republic of China established?
Who was Inaugurated in Nanjing as the first provisional president?
Who had control of the Beiyang army?
What did China agree to avoid the undermining of the Republic?

answers.text: agreed to Army's demand that China be united under a Beijing government.

qas.question: Who was sworn in as the second provisional president of the republic of China?

context: In <a0_0>1912<a0_0/>, the Republic of China was established and <a1_0>Sun Yat-sen<a1_0/> was inaugurated in Nanjing as the first Provisional President. But power in Beijing already had passed to <a2_0>Yuan Shikai<a2_0/>, who had effective control of the Beiyang Army, the most powerful military force in China at the time. To prevent civil war and possible foreign intervention from undermining the infant republic, leaders <a3_0>agreed to Army's demand that China be united under a Beijing government.<a3_0/> On March 10, in <a4_0>Beijing, Shikai<a4_0/> was sworn in as the second Provisional President of the Republic of China.
